required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a New Prognostic Score for Adult Patients With RAS Wild-type mCRC Treated With Vectibix® and FOLFIRI in First Line (VALIDATE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-interventional Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of First Line Therapy With Vectibix® in Combination With FOLFIRI and to Validate a Prognostic Score in Adult Patients With RAS Wild-type Metastatic Colorectal Cancer in a Real World Setting (VALIDATE)

brief_summary.textblock: A safety and efficacy study of first line therapy with Vectibix® in combination with irinotecan, 5‑fluorouracil, and folinic acid (FOLFIRI) to validate a prognostic score in adult patients with RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer in a real world setting (VALIDATE)

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a non-interventional, prospective, open-label, single-arm, 3-cohort, multicenter study in Germany. In total, 1,240 patients will be enrolled in 100 oncological sites (office-based medical oncologists, oncology outpatient-centers, and university hospitals) in a time period of 36 months. Of these, 420 patients with high risk, 420 patients with intermediate risk, and 400 patients with low risk, as a priori assessed by the metastatic colorectal cancer prognostic score (mCCS), will be included. Overall survival of the pre-defined prognostic groups will be analyzed as primary endpoint to validate the mCCS.
Patients have been scheduled to receive first line combination therapy with panitumumab and FOLFIRI according to German regulations and current German SmPC. Data on efficacy in terms of tumor response evaluation / survival and safety (ADRs) will be collected during first line therapy. A subset of patients participating in the 'VALIDATE-PRO' project (n=620; 75 sites) will be assessed for general and health-related quality of life with patient questionnaires. Biomarker status beyond RAS will be collected at baseline. The documentation of defined patient data including survival will continue until the end of the individual study participation which is latest 36 month after last patient in. The end of study will be at latest at 36 months after last patient in (LPI).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) of pre-defined risk groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
primary_outcome.description: OS is defined as time from start of first line therapy to the date of death. For patients without date of start of first line therapy, date of informed consent will be the relevant date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as time from start of first line therapy to the date of death.
2-yrs OSR is defined as percentage of patients who are alive at 2 years after start of first line therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of progression or death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as time from start of first line therapy to first documentation of tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
2-yrs PFSR is defined as percentage of patients who are have not progressed or died due to any cause at 2 years after start of first line therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of progression or death to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as percentage of patients who achieve a partial or complete response as best response during the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Primary and secondary resection of metastases (liver/lung)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Data on primary and/or secondary resections of liver or lung metastases will be collected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment sequences with duration will be documented.

other_outcome.measure: Patient-reported general and health-related quality of life ('VALIDATE PRO')
other_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of first line therapy to date of progression or death due to any cause (assessed up to 72 months)
other_outcome.description: Quality of life will be assessed with the EORTC QLQ-C30 and the EORTC Colorectal Modul QLQ-CR29 patient questionnaires during first line treatment and correlated with outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: From start of first line therapy until 30 days after the end of treatment with panitumumab (assessed up to 72 months)

arm_group.description: Low risk according to metastatic Colorectal Cancer Prognostic Score (mCCS)
Medium risk according to metastatic Colorectal Cancer Prognostic Score (mCCS)
High risk according to metastatic Colorectal Cancer Prognostic Score (mCCS)

intervention.description: Patients will be scheduled to receive first line therapy with the combination of Panitumomab (6 mg / kg i.v, given once every two weeks) and FOLFIRI, according to current SmPC Germany.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with RAS-WT mCRC scheduled for the treatment with panitumumab and FOLFIRI who have not received any prior systemic antineoplastic therapy in the palliative setting.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligibility according to current SmPC
- Signed written informed consent
- Diagnosis of RAS-WT mCRC
- No prior systemic therapy in the palliative setting
- Aged 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindication according to current SmPC
- Participation in other clinical trials

overall_official.affiliation: Forschungs GbR Drs. Marschner, Zaiss, Kirste, Semsek
